ygData.messageBody:
I've been thinking about your Battle Cry idea. It has merit, but in
practice it isn't really tactically or strategically useful.

I've played a little shadowknight and a little paladin and experimented with
these once a day abilities. What I proposed earlier was similiar to the
shadowknight's ability and I was looking for feedback. After thinking about
it I realize that this kind of ability would do nothing to enhance the
overall melee effectiveness of the warrior class.

Lay Hands or Harm Touch are last ditch "save my ass" abilities. They can
arguably be used strategically to take on a higher level mob that a party
might not otherwise be able to kill, but it is usually a last ditch attempt
to finish a battle alive. Without having significant duration attached to
it the Battle Cry becomes another last ditch attempt to save the day, when
everything goes sour.

Now this isn't a bad idea. However I think that what the majority of us are
looking for is a way to enhance the long term combat effectiveness of the
warrior and to increase the average damage a warrior does per round over
that of a hybrid. The Battle Cry you propose does not accomplish that. In
a standard melee against a chasm minotaur with my paladin friend, I want to
be the one who dealt more melee damage at the end of the fight. I don't
care if the wizard zapped it for the most damage, I just want to be the one
to deal the single highest melee damage over all the rangers, paladins,
shadowknights, and so on. Right now all I do is suck up damage during a
fight, and then suck up mana in heals after the fight. The hybrids all have
some form of self healing, giving them an overall advantage so why should we
share melee ability with them? Shouldn't we be stronger? But now I am
ranting....

The skill enhancement I agree with.....why should warriors be capped in
weapons skills? That is all we are about. We should always continue to
grow.

-----Original Message-----
From: Wayne Sheppard <mrwayne@...>
To: warriors_eq@onelist.com <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, June 14, 1999 5:46 PM
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Digest Number 63


>From: "Wayne Sheppard" <mrwayne@...>
>
>I don't want Warriors to get Critical Strike, at least not as it has been
>presented on this list. While we could use a combat boost, I'd rather we
go
>another way.
>
>I don't want another skill that works all the time without any strategy as
>to when to use it. I'd rather be able to have a skill that I can use when
I
>want to. I want to be able to choose to use my skill to change the outcome
>of a battle
>
>I don't want another skill to replace kick/bash. We will then just use the
>most effecient skill all the time.
>
>I'm proposing again my Battle Cry. For 20 seconds, you get Double Attack
>Speed, +25 STR and +25 AC. What would be even better is if EVERYONE in
your
>group gained the benefits of the Battle Cry. Something this powerful would
>be limited to once per day, just like Lay Hands.
>
>I also believe that the Warriors should have a general combat boost, maybe
>6*lvl+5 for the combat skills.
>
>
>Wayne
>
>
>> Date: Mon, 14 Jun 1999 12:10:32 -0400
>> From: "Tom Swift" <tswift@...>
>>Subject: Re: Warriors vs Hybrids
>>
>>You missed my point.
>>
>>"Have you ever seen to guys sword fighting and watch one guy kick at the
>>same time he is trying to stick him? :) "
>>
>>The critical strike should be attached to an attack, and not in place of
>>one. A sword swing could be a critical strike, or maybe a kick could be,
>or
>>even a bash could be a critical strike. Any attack can be used to deliver
>>critical damage.
>>
>>Second point.
>>
>>"Having the abilities go up like parry and dodge would make it too
powerful
>>I believe. They go up without the need to use them. "
>>
>>The only thing you are doing by making this an invoked skill is giving
>>warriors another key to tap repeatedly in combat. You are forcing
warriors
>>to choose between most likely doing 11 damage with a kick or maybe getting
>a
>>critical hit. I don't agree. Warriors can and should use everything at
>>their disposal, slash and kick or bash, and at the same time be looking
for
>>an opportunity to strike a critical hit. A critical hit is not something
>>you just decided to do, you take an opportunity. Your suggestion indicates
>>that parry/dodge is a random part of combat. I argue that it is indeed a
>>skill, one which I wish was successful more often. It isn't random
because
>>a warrior will endeavor to parry and dodge all attacks, and not just
>>randomly manage to avoid them. I speak from real life experience on this
>>one not just about the game.
>>
>>I see where you are going with the critical hit thing, but in the context
>of
>>EQ the usefulness of the skill would be much hampered by your "invoked"
>>method. The average gamers style of play is to pick an attack and keep
>>using it. I for one, would simply max out my critical hit skill in party
>>fighting against yellow and red mobs. Then I would use the skill at every
>>opportunity. My dark elf warrior would likely max the skill in a single
>>level, and be very successful using it. I fear that barbarians, ogres and
>>trolls would be at a disadvantage here.
>>
>>I am solidly convinced that the parry/dodge method is the right way to go,
>>and let EQ check when to use the skill and check its success. Then
>critical
>>hit won't just become a replacement for kick/bash but instead become the
>>real enhancement to our class we all think is needed.
>>
>>
>>
